    • 兩 [ liǎng ] two, both, pair, couple; ounce
heisig_chinese_memo: I have different vehicles like my yoke (two animals held together) for transporting my stuff, and my car for transporting me.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: I have different vehicles like my yoke (two animals held together) for transporting my stuff, and my car for transporting me.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " car ", " two " sound, used as a quantifier, can be used for vehicles, sedan. In ancient times, cars generally had two wheels, so one or two vehicles were called one or two each time they ride, which was later written as " vehicle ." "Water Margin" Chapter 95: "Fifty trains crowded out from the front and back, all of which were equipped with reeds to ignite the fire."

" Vehicles " can also be used for things like shoes and socks in pairs. Song Zhoumi's "Hao Ranzhai Audiovisual Transcript": "I can carry a few clogs in my life, but only one game of chess can be eliminated in a long day.
humanum_short_description_en: From the " car ", " two " sound, as a quantifier.
humanum_full_description:
從「車」，「兩」聲，用作量詞，可用於車輛、轎子。古代的車一般有兩個輪子，故車一乘即稱一兩，後來寫作「輛」。《水滸傳》第95回：「前後擁出五十輛火車，車上都裝蘆葦引火之物。」

　　「輛」也可用於鞋襪等成雙的東西。宋周密〈浩然齋視聽抄〉：「平生能著幾輛屐，長日惟消一局棋。」

從「 車 」，「 兩 」聲，用作量詞，可用於車輛、轎子。古代的車一般有兩個輪子，故車一乘即稱一兩，後來寫作「 輛 」。《水滸傳》第95回：「前後擁出五十輛火車，車上都裝蘆葦引火之物。」 「 輛 」也可用於鞋襪等成雙的東西。宋周密〈浩然齋視聽抄〉：「平生能著幾輛屐，長日惟消一局棋。」
From " car", " two" sound, used as a quantifier, can be used for vehicles, sedan. In ancient times, cars generally had two wheels, so one or two vehicles were called one or two each time they ride, which was later written as " vehicle." "Water Margin" Chapter 95: "Fifty trains crowded out from the front and back, all of which were equipped with reeds to ignite the fire." " Vehicles" can also be used for things like shoes and socks in pairs. Song Zhoumi's "Hao Ranzhai Audiovisual Transcript": "I can carry a few clogs in my life, but only one game of chess can be eliminated in a long day.

輛字的基本解释

輛
liàng
见“辆”。

輛字的汉语字典释义

[①]［liàng］
［《字彙》力仗切］
“兩2”的今字。“辆1”的繁体字。亦作“輌1”。
(1)量词。乘。用于车辆。古代的车一般有两个轮子，故车一乘即称一两，后来写作“輛”。
(2)量词。顶。用于轿子。
(3)量词。双。用于鞋袜等成双的东西。
(4)与“车”连用，车辆，车的统称。参见“車輛”。
(5)犹驾。谓准备好车轿。

輛字的康熙字典解释

【酉集下】【車字部】　輛； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1244第19
【廣韻】里獎切【集韻】里養切【韻會】力讓切【正韻】良獎切，?音兩。與兩同。【韻會】乗也，匹也，又車數。【漢書註】車一乗曰一兩，言其輪轅兩兩而耦也。【詩·周南】百兩御之。【註】百兩，百乗也。【疏】車一乗爲一兩。【風俗通】車有兩輪，馬有四匹，故車稱兩，馬稱匹。

輛字的源字形

輛字的起名意思

暂无。

Vehicles
Basic explanation of words
Vehicles
liàng
See "vehicle".
Vehicles
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［liàng］
["Words" forcefully cuts]
The present word for "two 2". Traditional characters for "车1". Also known as "輌1".
(1) Quantifiers. Multiply. Used in vehicles. In ancient times, cars generally had two wheels, so one or two vehicles were called one or two when they took a ride. Later, they were written as "vehicles."
(2) Quantifiers. top. Used in sedan chair.
(3) Quantifiers. double. Used for things in pairs such as footwear.
(4) Used in conjunction with "vehicle", a collective term for vehicles and vehicles. See "Vehicles".
(5) Still driving. Said that the sedan is ready.
Vehicles
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[You Ji 2] [Car Character Department] 　 Car; Kangxi strokes: 15; Page number: Page 1244 Page 19
[Guang Yun] Li prize cut [Ji Yun] Li Yang cut [Yun Hui] force cut [Zheng Yun] good prize cut, two sounds. Same with two. [Rhyme Club] Take a ride, a horse, and a number of cars. [Hanshu Note] A car is a ride, and it is said that one or two, and its wheels are coupled in pairs. [Poetry·Zhou Nan] One hundred two imperial ones. [Note] One hundred two, one hundred times. [Sparse] One or two cars make one ride. [Customs] There are two wheels for a car and four for a horse, so a car is called two and a horse is called a horse.
